meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Steve Spriensma Marilyn Maher Suzanne Koppelman Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7799.

td.p: Steve Spriensma, a writer from Port Dover, Ontario, Canada
Marilyn Maher, an administrative specialist from Athens, Ohio
Suzanne Koppelman, a museum education manager from New York, New York (whose 3-day cash winnings total $63,601)

tr.td: MAY THE HORSE BE WITH YOU
RECENT STUFF
MOVIE SEQUEL SUBTITLES
"L"AKES
BOOKS & AUTHORS
HIGH-SCORING SCRABBLE WORDS

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'I say! Old sport! Known as ponies, the horses used in this sport with chukkers have been known to play past age 25')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: I say! Old sport! Known as ponies, the horses used in this sport with chukkers have been known to play past age 25

tr.td: Suzanne
Marilyn

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Suzanne
Marilyn
Steve
RICK & MORTY
SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT
KEEP SUMMER SAFE
MY "MAN"!
YOU PASS BUTTER
& THAT'S THE WAY THE NEWS GOES

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: Mark Twain referred to her as the little lady who started the Civil War.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Her 1896 New York Times obituary called her "the writer of probably the most widely read work of fiction ever penned"')

tr.td: AMERICAN AUTHORS
Her 1896 New York Times obituary called her "the writer of probably the most widely read work of fiction ever penned"
Suzanne
Marilyn
Steve
2nd place: $2,000
New champion: $14,401
3rd place: $1,000
Suzanne
Marilyn
Steve

16 R,
5 W
(including 3 DDs)

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
